title: Crisp Winter Salad with Ginger-Garlic Vinaigrette
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Crisp Winter Salad with Ginger-Garlic Vinaigrette a try. This recipe makes 4 servings with 149 calories, 2g of protein, and 14g of fat each. For $1.6 per serving, this recipe covers 9% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of rice vinegar, olive oil, garlic cloves, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and vegan diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 20 minutes. It is perfect for Winter. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 69%. This score is pretty good. Try Garlic-Ginger Noodle Soup with Winter Greens, Crisp Winter Salad with Maple Gorgonzola Dressing, and Winter Salad with Citrus Vinaigrette for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large bowl, lightly toss the radicchio and endives. In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and ginger and cook over moderate heat until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the vinegar. Stir the vinaigrette and pour it over the salad. Sprinkle with salt, toss well and serve.

steps.step: In a large bowl, lightly toss the radicchio and endives. In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook over moderate heat until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and add the vinegar. Stir the vinaigrette and pour it over the salad.
Sprinkle with salt, toss well and serve.
